doc.source_uri: 2025-08-31/AMEC - A Upbeat trend to be sustained with diversified product portfolio maintain OWAMEC - A Upbeat trend to be sustaine_2025-08-31

passages.text: Upbeat trend to be sustained with diversified product portfolio; main in OW

AMEC's share price is up \(3\%\) in the past one month, underperforming the A- share Semi index by \(20\%\) , due largely to weak guidance on China WFE demand from overseas companies (link). However, we keep our constructive view and expect the resilient trend of Semiconductor capital spending in China to be driven by advanced memory and logic capacity expansion. Thus, we expect domestic players such as AMEC to benefit more with an increasing localization rate, and we currently model \(49\% /65\%\) sales/earnings CAGR during 2025- 27 for AMEC. Our new price target of Rmb230.0 is based on 20x one- year forward P/E.

Upbeat trend sustained. AMEC reported 2Q25 sales of Rmb2.8bn \((+51\% /28\%\) YoY/QoQ) and net profit of Rmb393mn \((+47\% /25\%\) YoY/QoQ), but gross margin declined by 3ppts sequentially owing to relatively high cost incurred for new (high- end) equipment. Notably, contract liability/ inventory kept the upward trend, which indicates a robust demand outlook ahead.

Diversifying the product offering successfully and rapidly. The company guided \(\sim 40\%\) YoY growth of new orders in 1H, and remains confident about the annual trend. Meanwhile, the ICP order backlog outpaced that of CCP equipment, which suggests AMEC is gaining momentum on advanced logic (as well as DRAM) demand other than its leadership in NAND demand/applications, in our view. In addition, AMEC is on track to proliferate its thin- film business, especially on higher- end LPCVD, ALD, EPI, etc., which booked c.Rmb0.2bn \((+6x\) YoY) revenue in 1H25, thanks to its continuously intensive R&D investment.

Reiterate OW. We roughly maintain our revenue forecasts, but revise down our 2026/27E earnings by \(12\% /12\%\) respectively to reflect the inferior margin of newly debuted equipment in the near term and heavy R&D spending for expanding TAM. We are confident about AMEC as a key beneficiary of robust China Semiconductor capex as well as localization trends, and maintain an OW rating. We extend our PT timeframe to Dec- 26 at Rmb230.0, based on an unchanged 20x one- year forward P/E.

As the second- largest semiconductor equipment manufacturer in China, we expect AMEC to benefit from the decoupling of the semiconductor supply chain and then accelerating localization of wafer fabrication equipment (WFE) spending. Given its growing presence in the domestic etching market, we believe key customers' solid capacity expansion plans and AMEC's diversifying product offerings should lead to growth potential in the long term. We model a \(49\% /65\%\) sales/earnings CAGR for 2025- 27E. Maintain OW.
Our Dec- 26 price target of Rmb230.0 is based on a 20x one- year forward P/E, which is around the historical average for its global peers.

AMEC - A (Overweight; Price Target: Rmb230.00)

As the second- largest semiconductor equipment manufacturer in China, we expect AMEC to benefit from the decoupling of the semiconductor supply chain and then accelerating localization of wafer fabrication equipment (WFE) spending. Given its growing presence in the domestic etching market, we believe key customers' solid capacity expansion plans and AMEC's diversifying product offerings should lead to growth potential in the long term. We model a 49%/65% sales/earnings CAGR for 2025- 27E. Maintain OW.
Our Dec- 26 price target of Rmb230.0 is based on a 20x one- year forward P/E, which is around the historical average for its global peers.
Source: Company reports and J.P. Morgan estimates. Note: Rmb in millions (except per-share data), Fiscal year ends Dec. o/w - out of which

J.P. Morgan uses the following rating system: Overweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will outperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); Neutral (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will perform in line with the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); and Underweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe. NR is Not Rated. In this case, J.P. Morgan has removed the rating and, if applicable, the price target, for this stock because of either a lack of a sufficient fundamental basis or for legal, regulatory or policy reasons. The previous rating and, if applicable, the price target, no longer should be relied upon. An NR designation is not a

recommendation or a rating. In Americas equity research, some stocks under coverage have a rating but no price target; in these cases, we expect the stock will outperform/perform in line/underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe over the next six to 12 months. In our Asia (ex-Australia and ex-India) and U.K. small- and mid-cap Equity Research, each stock's expected total return is compared to the expected total return of a benchmark country market index, not to those Research Analysts' coverage universe. If it does not appear in the Important Disclosures section of this report, the certifying Research Analyst's coverage universe can be found on J.P. Morgan's Research website, https://www.jpmorganmarkets.com.
